item.title: Tree of Binomial Distribution
item.description: Binomial Distribution Applications Binomial Mixture Distributions Main Groups for Binomial Distribution Other With No Sub-Groups Binomial Not Parent Alternate Binomial Distributions Neyman Type A Distribution Hermite Distribution Binomial Parent N/n , K and Y Mixtures p Transformed Binomial Cumulative Distribution Function p Binomial Binomial Distribution The binomial distribution can be defined, using the binomial expansion \[ (q+p)^n = \sum_{x=0}^{n} {n \choose k} p^k q^{(n-k)} = \sum_{x=0}^{n} \frac{n!
